CHAT: Chat with your collaborator by typing in this box!
AUTH: Please authorize this app to enable your work to be saved and to allow it to be shared by you.
MOTOR_ON_TOOLTIP: Turns motor on with specific power.
MOTOR_ON_FOR_TOOLTIP: Turns motor on and stops motor after execution of rotations/degrees.
MOTOR_GETPOWER_TOOLTIP: Gets current power of this motor.
MOTORDIFF_ON_TOOLTIP: Starts the robot with specific speed.
MOTORDIFF_ON_HELP: The robot drives forwards until it is not stopped or it is used different block for driving. The speed can be set in the field speed. When the program ends the motors will stop automatically
MOTORDIFF_ON_FOR_TOOLTIP: Starts the robot with specific speed and stops after specific distance.
MOTORDIFF_STOP_HELP: The robot will stop, by stopping the both motors.
MOTORDIFF_TURN_FOR_TOOLTIP: Turns the robot for number of degrees.
MOTORDIFF_TURN_FOR_HELP: The robot will rotate until it reaches the degrees set by the user.
DISPLAY_PICTURE_TOOLTIP: Displays a picture on the screen.
DISPLAY_PICTURE_HELP: Show image on the display of the robot. Choose the image! With x and y can be set the position of the image on the display.
DISPLAY_TEXT_TOOLTIP: Displays a text on the screen.
DISPLAY_TEXT_HELP: Display text or numbers on the robot display. With the column and row parameter change the position of the text in the display.
DISPLAY_CLEAR_HELP: The display of the robot will be cleared.
PLAY_TONE_HELP: The robot will play a tone. The frequency of the tone can be set between 270 and 10000. The human ear cannot hear anything above or below this frequency.
PLAY_SETVOLUME_HELP: You can set the volume of the robot. 0 is mute and 100 is the max. volume.
BRICKLIGHT_ON_HELP: You can choose which the color of the light for the keys, also you can choose the key lights to be lit or blinking.
BRICKLIGHT_OFF_HELP: Turn of the lights of the EV3 buttons.
BRICKLIGHT_RESET_TOOLTIP: Resets EV3 bricklight. Sets the default EV3 bricklight: green and blinking.
BRICKLIGHT_RESET_HELP: Reset the light settings of the EV3 buttons.
START_TOOLTIP: The starting point for the main program.
WAIT_TOOLTIP: Waits for a condition becoming true.
IFELSE_TOOLTIP: Checks the condition in 'if'. If the condition is true, executes the 'do' action; otherwise executes the 'else' action
IF_TOOLTIP: Checks the condition in 'if'. If the condition is true, executes the 'do' action.
GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current reading from choosen sensor.
KEY_ISPRESSEDANDRELEASED_TOOLTIP: Is the specific button pressed and released?
ULTRASONIC_SETMODE_TOOLTIP: Sets the mode of the ultrasonic sensor.
ULTRASONIC_GETMODE_TOOLTIP: Gets the mode of the ultrasonic sensor.
ULTRASONIC_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current reading from the ultrasonic sensor.
COLOUR_SETMODE_TOOLTIP: Sets the mode of the colour sensor.
COLOUR_GETMODE_TOOLTIP: Gets the mode of the colour sensor.
COLOUR_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current reading from the colour sensor.
INFRARED_SETMODE_TOOLTIP: Sets the mode of the infrared sensor.
INFRARED_GETMODE_TOOLTIP: Gets the mode of the infrared sensor.
INFRARED_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current reading from the infrared sensor.
ENCODER_SETMODE_TOOLTIP: Sets the mode of the motor encoder.
ENCODER_GETMODE_TOOLTIP: Gets the mode of the motor encoder.
ENCODER_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current reading from the motor encoder.
GYRO_SETMODE_TOOLTIP: Sets the mode of the gyro sensor.
GYRO_GETMODE_TOOLTIP: Gets the mode of the gyro sensor.
GYRO_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current reading from the gyro sensor.
TIMER_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current reading from the timer.
EV3BRICK_HELP:
The brains of your robot;-)
You can plug in sensors to the sensor ports 1 - 4 and motors to the motor ports A - D. Wheel diameter and track width are important so that the robot is properly controlled with all »driving« blocks.
ULTRASONIC_HELP:
The brains of your robot;-)
You can plug in sensors to the sensor ports 1 - 4 and motors to the motor ports A - D. Wheel diameter and track width are important so that the robot is properly controlled with all »driving« blocks.
COLOUR_HELP: The color sensor detects colors, but also the light intensity in the environment or different gray values from black to white. Thus it is well-suited for line following robots.
INFRARED_HELP: The infrared sensor measures distances to an object. So it is well-suited for obstacle avoidancing robots. With the IR beacon, which emits infrared light itself, you can remotely control the robot. The infrared sensor can receive the signals of this IR Beacon.
TOUCH_HELP: The touch sensor detects whether the red part of the sensor is pressed or not. He is particularly well suited as a switch or for a bumper car (robot).
GYRO_HELP: The gyro sensor measures rotating movements. Depending on how it is mounted on the robot, it can realize how many degrees the robot has rotated or if the robot is in an inclined position.
MOTOR_BIG_HELP: The big motor is a so-called servomotor. You can control its rotational speed and acceleration, since it has a built-in rotation sensor. For programming with the »driving« blocks it is important to know how it is mounted on the robot.
MOTOR_MIDDLE_HELP: The middle motor is a so-called servomotor. You can control its rotational speed and acceleration, since it has a built-in rotation sensor. For the programming blocks it is important to know in which direction it should rotate.
ACTOR_HELP: This block can be used as a placeholder for any device that requires electricity, e.g. light bulb or LED.
COLOUR_PICKER_TOOLTIP: Choose a colour from the palette.
COLOUR_RGB_TOOLTIP: Create a colour with the specified amount of red, green, and blue.  All values must be between 0 and 100.
COLOUR_BLEND_TOOLTIP: Blends two colours together with a given ratio (0.0 - 1.0).
CONTROLS_WHILEUNTIL_TOOLTIP_WHILE: While a value is true, then do some statements.
CONTROLS_WHILEUNTIL_TOOLTIP_UNTIL: While a value is false, then do some statements.
CONTROLS_FOR_TOOLTIP: Have the variable %1 take on the values from the start number to the end number, counting by the specified interval, and do the specified blocks.
CONTROLS_FOREACH_TOOLTIP: For each item in a list, set the variable '%1' to the item, and then do some statements.
CONTROLS_FLOW_STATEMENTS_OPERATOR_CONTIN: continue with next iteration of loop
CONTROLS_FLOW_STATEMENTS_TOOLTIP_BREAK: Break out of the containing loop.
CONTROLS_FLOW_STATEMENTS_TOOLTIP_CONTINU: Skip the rest of this loop, and continue with the next iteration.
CONTROLS_FLOW_STATEMENTS_WARNING: Warning: This block may only be used within a loop.
CONTROLS_IF_TOOLTIP_1: If a value is true, then do some statements.
CONTROLS_IF_TOOLTIP_2: If a value is true, then do the first block of statements.  Otherwise, do the second block of statements.
CONTROLS_IF_TOOLTIP_3: If the first value is true, then do the first block of statements.  Otherwise, if the second value is true, do the second block of statements.
CONTROLS_IF_TOOLTIP_4: If the first value is true, then do the first block of statements.  Otherwise, if the second value is true, do the second block of statements.  If none of the values are true, do the last block of statements.
CONTROLS_IF_IF_TOOLTIP: Add, remove, or reorder sections to reconfigure this if block.
CONTROLS_IF_ELSEIF_TOOLTIP: Add a condition to the if block.
CONTROLS_IF_ELSE_TOOLTIP: Add a final, catch-all condition to the if block.
LOGIC_COMPARE_TOOLTIP_EQ: Return true if both inputs equal each other.
LOGIC_COMPARE_TOOLTIP_NEQ: Return true if both inputs are not equal to each other.
LOGIC_COMPARE_TOOLTIP_LT: Return true if the first input is smaller than the second input.
LOGIC_COMPARE_TOOLTIP_LTE: Return true if the first input is smaller than or equal to the second input.
LOGIC_COMPARE_TOOLTIP_GT: Return true if the first input is greater than the second input.
LOGIC_COMPARE_TOOLTIP_GTE: Return true if the first input is greater than or equal to the second input.
LOGIC_OPERATION_TOOLTIP_AND: Return true if both inputs are true.
LOGIC_OPERATION_TOOLTIP_OR: Return true if at least one of the inputs is true.
LOGIC_NEGATE_TOOLTIP: Returns true if the input is false.  Returns false if the input is true.
LOGIC_TERNARY_TOOLTIP: Check the condition in 'test'. If the condition is true, returns the 'if true' value; otherwise returns the 'if false' value.
MATH_ARITHMETIC_TOOLTIP_ADD: Return the sum of the two numbers.
MATH_ARITHMETIC_TOOLTIP_MINUS: Return the difference of the two numbers.
MATH_ARITHMETIC_TOOLTIP_MULTIPLY: Return the product of the two numbers.
MATH_ARITHMETIC_TOOLTIP_DIVIDE: Return the quotient of the two numbers.
MATH_ARITHMETIC_TOOLTIP_POWER: Return the first number raised to the power of the second number.
MATH_SINGLE_TOOLTIP_ROOT: Return the square root of a number.
MATH_SINGLE_TOOLTIP_ABS: Return the absolute value of a number.
MATH_SINGLE_TOOLTIP_NEG: Return the negation of a number.
MATH_SINGLE_TOOLTIP_LN: Return the natural logarithm of a number.
MATH_SINGLE_TOOLTIP_LOG10: Return the base 10 logarithm of a number.
MATH_SINGLE_TOOLTIP_EXP: Return e to the power of a number.
MATH_SINGLE_TOOLTIP_POW10: Return 10 to the power of a number.
MATH_TRIG_TOOLTIP_SIN: Provides the sine of a given angle in degree.
MATH_TRIG_TOOLTIP_COS: Provides the sine of a given angle in degree.
MATH_TRIG_TOOLTIP_TAN: Provides the tangent of a given angle in degree.
MATH_TRIG_TOOLTIP_ASIN: Return the arcsine of a number.
MATH_TRIG_TOOLTIP_ACOS: Return the arccosine of a number.
MATH_TRIG_TOOLTIP_ATAN: Return the arctangent of a number.
MATH_CONSTANT_TOOLTIP: Return one of the common constants: p (3.141…), e (2.718…), φ (1.618…), sqrt(2) (1.414…), sqrt(½) ( .7 7…), or ∞ (infinity).
MATH_IS_TOOLTIP: Check if a number is an even, odd, prime, whole, positive, negative, or if it is divisible by certain number.  Returns true or false.
MATH_ROUND_TOOLTIP: Round a number up or down.
MATH_ONLIST_TOOLTIP_SUM: Return the sum of all the numbers in the list.
MATH_ONLIST_TOOLTIP_MIN: Return the smallest number in the list.
MATH_ONLIST_TOOLTIP_MAX: Return the largest number in the list.
MATH_ONLIST_TOOLTIP_AVERAGE: Return the average (arithmetic mean) of the numeric values in the list.
MATH_ONLIST_TOOLTIP_MEDIAN: Return the median number in the list.
MATH_ONLIST_TOOLTIP_MODE: Return a list of the most common item(s) in the list.
MATH_ONLIST_TOOLTIP_STD_DEV: Return the standard deviation of the list.
MATH_ONLIST_TOOLTIP_RANDOM: Return a random element from the list.
MATH_MODULO_TOOLTIP: Return the remainder from dividing the two numbers.
MATH_CONSTRAIN_TOOLTIP: Constrain a number to be between the specified limits (inclusive).
MATH_RANDOM_INT_TOOLTIP: Return a random integer between the two specified limits, inclusive.
MATH_RANDOM_FLOAT_TOOLTIP: Return a random fraction between 0.0 (inclusive) and 1.0 (exclusive).
TEXT_TEXT_TOOLTIP: A letter, word, or line of text.
TEXT_JOIN_TOOLTIP: Create a piece of text by joining together any number of items.
TEXT_CREATE_JOIN_TOOLTIP: Add, remove, or reorder sections to reconfigure this text block.
TEXT_CREATE_JOIN_ITEM_TOOLTIP: Add an item to the text.
TEXT_LENGTH_TOOLTIP: Returns the number of letters (including spaces) in the provided text.
TEXT_ISEMPTY_TOOLTIP: Returns true if the provided text is empty.
TEXT_INDEXOF_TOOLTIP: Returns the index of the first/last occurrence of first text in the second text.  Returns 0 if text is not found.
TEXT_CHARAT_TOOLTIP: Returns the letter at the specified position.
TEXT_GET_SUBSTRING_TOOLTIP: Returns a specified portion of the text.
TEXT_GET_SUBSTRING_START_FROM_END: get substring from letter # from end
TEXT_CHANGECASE_TOOLTIP: Return a copy of the text in a different case.
TEXT_TRIM_TOOLTIP: Return a copy of the text with spaces removed from one or both ends.
TEXT_TRIM_OPERATOR_BOTH: trim spaces from both sides of
TEXT_TRIM_OPERATOR_LEFT: trim spaces from left side of
TEXT_TRIM_OPERATOR_RIGHT: trim spaces from right side of
TEXT_PRINT_TOOLTIP: Print the specified text, number or other value.
TEXT_PROMPT_TOOLTIP_NUMBER: Prompt for user for a number.
TEXT_PROMPT_TOOLTIP_TEXT: Prompt for user for some text.
LISTS_CREATE_EMPTY_TOOLTIP: Returns a list, of length 0, containing no data records
LISTS_CREATE_WITH_TOOLTIP: Create a list with any number of items.
LISTS_CREATE_WITH_CONTAINER_TOOLTIP: Add, remove, or reorder sections to reconfigure this list block.
LISTS_CREATE_WITH_ITEM_TOOLTIP: Add an item to the list.
LISTS_REPEAT_TOOLTIP: Creates a list consisting of the given value repeated the specified number of times.
LISTS_REPEAT_TITLE: create %1 list with item %2 repeated %3 times
LISTS_LENGTH_TOOLTIP: Returns the length of a list.
LISTS_TOOLTIP: Returns true if the list is empty.
LISTS_INDEX_OF_TOOLTIP: Returns the index of the first/last occurrence of the item in the list.  Returns 0 if text is not found.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_GET_FROM_START: Returns the item at the specified position in a list.  #1 is the first item.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_GET_FROM_END: Returns the item at the specified position in a list.  #1 is the last item.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_GET_FIRST: Returns the first item in a list.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_GET_LAST: Returns the last item in a list.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_GET_RANDOM: Returns a random item in a list.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_GET_REMOVE_FROM_: Removes and returns the item at the specified position in a list.  #1 is the first item.
Removes and returns the item at the specified position in a list.  #1 is the last item.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_GET_REMOVE_FIRST: Removes and returns the first item in a list.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_GET_REMOVE_LAST: Removes and returns the last item in a list.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_GET_REMOVE_RANDO: Removes and returns a random item in a list.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_REMOVE_FROM_STAR: Removes the item at the specified position in a list.  #1 is the first item.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_REMOVE_FROM_END: Removes the item at the specified position in a list.  #1 is the last item.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_REMOVE_FIRST: Removes the first item in a list.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_REMOVE_LAST: Removes the last item in a list.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_REMOVE_RANDOM: Removes a random item in a list.
LISTS_SET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_SET_FROM_START: Sets the item at the specified position in a list.  #1 is the first item.
LISTS_SET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_SET_FROM_END: Sets the item at the specified position in a list.  #1 is the last item.
LISTS_SET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_SET_FIRST: Sets the first item in a list.
LISTS_SET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_SET_LAST: Sets the last item in a list.
LISTS_SET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_SET_RANDOM: Sets a random item in a list.
LISTS_SET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_INSERT_FROM_STAR: Inserts the item at the specified position in a list.  #1 is the first item.
LISTS_SET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_INSERT_FROM_END: Inserts the item at the specified position in a list.  #1 is the last item.
LISTS_SET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_INSERT_FIRST: Inserts the item at the start of a list.
LISTS_SET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_INSERT_LAST: Append the item to the end of a list.
LISTS_SET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_INSERT_RANDOM: Inserts the item randomly in a list.
LISTS_GET_SUBLIST_TOOLTIP: Creates a copy of the specified portion of a list.
VARIABLES_GET_TOOLTIP: Returns the value of this variable.
VARIABLES_SET_TOOLTIP: Sets this variable to be equal to the input.
VARIABLE_GLOBAL_HELP:
With this block you can declare a global variable. In a global variable you can store values, that you would like to access somewhere in your program later. You can
  • modify the name of the variable
  • choose the right type of the variable
  • set the initial value
PROCEDURES_DEFNORETURN_TOOLTIP: Creates a function with no output.
PROCEDURES_DEFRETURN_TOOLTIP: Creates a function with an output.
PROCEDURES_DEF_DUPLICATE_WARNING: Warning: This function has duplicate parameters.
PROCEDURES_CALLRETURN_TOOLTIP: Run the user-defined function '%1' and use its output.
PROCEDURES_MUTATORCONTAINER_TOOLTIP: Add, remove, or reorder inputs to this function.
PROCEDURES_MUTATORARG_TOOLTIP: Add an input to the function.
PROCEDURES_IFRETURN_TOOLTIP: If a value is true, then return a second value.
PROCEDURES_IFRETURN_WARNING: Warning: This block may be used only within a function definition.
PROCEDURES_VARIABLES_ERROR: Error: This block may be used only within the '
PROCEDURES_VARIABLES_LOOP_ERROR: Error: This block may be used only within a loop which delcares
SENSOR_GET_SAMPLE_HELP: The help text will appear here
CONNECTION_START_HELP: This block tries to make a connection to another robot via bluetooth. It is looking for a robot with the name in the textfield. This block returns the connection, best you save it in a global variable of the type »Connection«. Once the other robot is accepting the connection you can exchange messages with it.
CONNECTION_WAIT_HELP: With this block you can wait for a connection via bluetooth. If another robot is trying to make a connection with your robot, you should use this block to wait and accept this connection.
CONNECTION_RECEIVE_HELP: This block is waiting for a message from the robot which you declare in the connection. The output of this block is a text message.
CONNECTION_SEND_HELP: You can send a text message to another robot with this block. Add the text message to the block and also do not forget to add the name of the connection to know where to send the message.
CONNECTION_START_TOOLTIP: Tries to make a connection to another robot via bluetooth.
CONNECTION_WAIT_TOOLTIP: Waits for a connection via bluetooth.
CONNECTION_RECEIVE_TOOLTIP: Waits for a message from the robot which you declare in the connection.
CONNECTION_SEND_TOOLTIP: Sends a text message to another robot.
START_HELP:
With this as a first block starts your program. All the other blocks that are connected are processed sequentially.
Additionally, you can add variables by clicking on the plus. All variables that are »declared« here are global. Values can be stored in the variables and later used in the program.
POPUP_ABOUT_TEXT: The Open Roberta Lab is a cloud-based integrated programming environment that enables children and adolescents to program easily Lego Mindstorms EV3 robots. This platform is completely open source so taking part is desirable! Both the software and the open source developer tools are available via Fraunhofer servers.
POPUP_ABOUT_TEXT_DEV: The Open Roberta Lab is an open-source programming platform developed by Fraunhofer IAIS within the initiative »Roberta – Learning with Robots«
POPUP_ABOUT_TEXT_GOOG: Open Roberta was initiated in collaboration with Google Germany to reduce the hurdles for students, teachers and schools programming educational robots. Open Roberta is financed by Google.org (2014 - 2015) with 1Mio Euro.
POPUP_TEXT_STARTUP_MESSAGE:
Three things you should know before starting:
  • Here you can program EV3 robots
  • Your robot needs a special system check!
  • Your robot needs wi-fi or a USB program check!
  • If you are not sure, please have a look at the help pages ... more

What is new?

Version beta 1.2.
  • Now available in Finnish!
  • Blocks to send and receive messages
  • Connect your robot via USB
  • Rotate motors backwards with negative speed
  • Fixed many more bugs
POPUP_ROBOT_NOT_CONNECTED: You have to make a connection to your robot first.
POPUP_ROBOT_BUSY: Your robot is busy. Please wait until the current program has finished.
POPUP_CONFIRM_DELETE_PROGRAM: Do you really want to delete the program ?
POPUP_CONFIRM_DELETE_CONFIGURATION: Do you really want to delete the configuration ?
POPUP_BEFOREUNLOAD: You have unsaved changes in your program or configuration. Sign in and save your program or configuration.
POPUP_BEFOREUNLOAD_LOGGEDIN: You have unsaved changes in your program or configuration.
POPUP_CONFIRM_UPDATE_FIRMWARE: There is a new firmware version for your robot available. You can try to run programs with the old version, but best bet is to update your robot now! You just have to click >>Update now<< and restart the robots system afterwards.
MESSAGE_PASSWORD_ERROR: Something went wrong while you filled in the two passwords.
MESSAGE_INVALID_NAME: Please fill in a correct name. A correct name begins with a letter and can only content letters or numbers.
MESSAGE_EDIT_START: Your program $ will run in a moment!
MESSAGE_EDIT_SAVE_PROGRAM_AS: Your program has been saved as '$'
MESSAGE_EDIT_SAVE_CONFIGURATION_AS: Your configuration has been saved as '$'
MESSAGE_RELATION_DELETED: A relation of Program '$' was deleted
MESSAGE_RESTART_ROBOT: Your robot can only use the new firmware, if you restart its system. Just turn the robot off and on again and reconnect the robot afterwards to the Open Roberta Lab.
MESSAGE_FIRMWARE_ERROR: There is a conflict with the firmware version of your robot and the Open Roberta Lab. Please contact us.
ORA_TOKEN_SET_ERROR_NO_ROBOT_WAITING:
Check if your robot is switched on and connected to the server.
If you have problems to do this, please have a look at our help pages.
ORA_CONFIGURATION_ERROR_ID_INVALID: Configuration name is not a valid identifier.
ORA_CONFIGURATION_SAVE_ERROR_NOT_SAVED_T: An error error has occured while saving the configuration in the database.
ORA_CONFIGURATION_SAVE_ERROR: An error has occured while saving the robot configuration.
ORA_CONFIGURATION_DELETE_ERROR: An error has occured while deleting the robot configuration, please try it again!
ORA_PROGRAM_ERROR_ID_INVALID: The name of your  program is already used by the system. Please choose another name and try it again!
ORA_PROGRAM_GET_ONE_ERROR_NOT_LOGGED_IN: You are not logged in, please log in with your username and password or create a new user.
ORA_PROGRAM_SAVE_ERROR_NOT_SAVED_TO_DB: An error has occured while saving the program.
ORA_PROGRAM_DELETE_ERROR: An error error has occured while deleding the configuration. Please try it again!
ORA_USER_GET_ONE_ERROR_ID_OR_PASSWORD_WR: An error occured while logging in.
ORA_USER_DELETE_ERROR_NOT_DELETED_IN_DB: Error while deleting user in database.
ORA_ROBOT_PUSH_RUN: Robot waited and now the jar is pushed to the robot
ORA_ROBOT_FIRMWAREUPDATE_IMPOSSIBLE: An error has occured while updating the new firmware on your robot.
ORA_ROBOT_NOT_CONNECTED:
There is no robot connected. Check if your robot is switched on, connect it to the server and type in the robots password under robot - connect in the menu.
If you have problems to do this, please have a look at our help pages.
ORA_PROGRAM_TO_SHARE_DOES_NOT_EXIST: The program that you would like to share does not exist.
ORA_USER_TO_SHARE_SAME_AS_LOGIN_USER: You cannot share any programs with yourself.
ORA_USER_CREATE_ERROR_MISSING_REQ_FIELDS: Check all required input fields have been filled out.
CONFIGURATION_ERROR_SENSOR_MISSING: This sensor is not set to the port!
CONFIGURATION_ERROR_SENSOR_WRONG: Connected wrong sesnor to the given port!
CONFIGURATION_ERROR_MOTOR_LEFT_MISSING: Left motor missing in the configuration!
CONFIGURATION_ERROR_MOTOR_RIGHT_MISSING: Right motor missing in the configuration!
CONFIGURATION_ERROR_MOTOR_MISSING: Motor is missing on the given port!
DATATABLE_EMPTY_TABLE: There are no entries in this table
